\begin{align*}
&p_1(x_0) > p_2(x_0) \\
&\Rightarrow \frac{\pi_1\frac{1}{\sqrt{2 \pi} \sigma} \text{exp}\left( - \frac{1}{2 \sigma^2} (x_0 - \mu_1)^2 \right) }{ \sum_{l = 1}^K \pi_l \frac{1}{\sqrt{2 \pi} \sigma} \text{exp} \left( - \frac{1}{2 \sigma^2} (x - \mu_l)^2 \right) } > \frac{\pi_2\frac{1}{\sqrt{2 \pi} \sigma} \text{exp}\left( - \frac{1}{2 \sigma^2} (x_0 - \mu_2)^2 \right) }{ \sum_{l = 1}^K \pi_l \frac{1}{\sqrt{2 \pi} \sigma} \text{exp} \left( - \frac{1}{2 \sigma^2} (x - \mu_l)^2 \right) } ~~~\textit{common denom}\\
&\Rightarrow \pi_1\frac{1}{\sqrt{2 \pi} \sigma} \text{exp}\left( - \frac{1}{2 \sigma^2} (x_0 - \mu_1)^2 \right) > \pi_2\frac{1}{\sqrt{2 \pi} \sigma} \text{exp}\left( - \frac{1}{2 \sigma^2} (x_0 - \mu_2)^2 \right) ~~~\textit{rm constant, then log}\\
&\Rightarrow \log(\pi_1) - \frac{1}{2 \sigma^2} (x_0 - \mu_1)^2  > \log(\pi_2)  - \frac{1}{2 \sigma^2} (x_0 - \mu_2)^2 ~~~\textit{shift sides, expand}\\
&\Rightarrow -(x_0^2 - 2x_0\mu_1 + \mu_1^2) + (x_0^2-2x_0\mu_2+\mu_2^2) > 2\sigma^2(\log(\pi_1) - \log(\pi_2)) ~~~\textit{cancel and simplify}\\
&\Rightarrow 2(\mu_1-\mu_2)x_0 - (\mu_1^2-\mu_2^2) > 2\sigma^2(\log(\pi_2) - \log(\pi_1)) ~~~\textit{expand} \\
&\Rightarrow 2(\mu_1-\mu_2)x_0 - (\mu_1-\mu_2)(\mu_1+\mu_2) > 2\sigma^2(\log(\pi_2) - \log(\pi_1)) ~~~\textit{simplify}\\
&\Rightarrow 2x_0 - (\mu_1+\mu_2) > 2\sigma^2\frac{\log(\pi_2) - \log(\pi_1)}{(\mu_1-\mu_2)} ~~~\textit{shift sides}\\
&\Rightarrow x_0 > \frac{(\mu_1+\mu_2)}{2} + \sigma^2\frac{\log(\pi_2) - \log(\pi_1)}{(\mu_1-\mu_2)})\\
\\
&\text{if } \pi_1=\pi_2 \text{ then } x_0 > \frac{\mu_1+\mu_2}{2}
\end{align*}
